action.action-desc: Mrs. Rodgers of Washington (for herself, Mrs. Trahan, Mrs. Axne, and Mrs. Kim of California) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Energy and Commerce

form.official-title: To amend title V of the Public Health Service Act to reauthorize the Garrett Lee Smith Memorial Act, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Garrett Lee Smith Memorial Reauthorization Act.
Section 520C of the Public Health Service Act (42 U.S.C. 290bb–34) is amended—

paragraph.text: in subsection (a), by striking tribes, tribal organizations and inserting Tribes, Tribal organizations;
in subsection (b), by striking tribal each place it appears and inserting Tribal; and
in subsection (c), by striking $5,988,000 for each of fiscal years 2018 through 2022 and inserting $9,000,000 for each of fiscal years 2023 through 2027.

section.header: Garrett Lee Smith State and Tribal Youth Suicide Prevention and Early Intervention Grant Program
section.text: Section 520E of the Public Health Service Act (42 U.S.C. 290bb–36) is amended—

paragraph.text: in subsection (a), by striking tribal each place it appears and inserting Tribal;

subparagraph.text: by striking Indian tribe or tribal organization and inserting Indian Tribe or Tribal organization; and
by striking tribal youth and inserting Tribal youth;

paragraph.text: in subsection (c), in the matter preceding paragraph (1), by striking tribal each place it appears and inserting Tribal;
in subsection (e)(3), by striking tribal and inserting Tribal; and
in subsection (m), by striking $30,000,000 for each of fiscal years 2018 through 2022 and inserting $40,000,000 for each of fiscal years 2023 through 2027.

section.header: Garrett Lee Smith Campus Suicide Prevention Program
section.text: Section 520E–2(i) of the Public Health Service Act (42 U.S.C. 290bb–36b(i)) is amended by striking 2018 through 2022 and inserting 2023 through 2027.

section.header: Mental and Behavioral Health Outreach and Education
section.text: Section 549(f) of the Public Health Service Act (42 U.S.C. 290ee–4(f)) is amended by striking 2018 through 2022 and inserting 2023 through 2027.
